snapshot_name: Pressure Washing Customer Retention & Recurring Revenue System
use_case: Turn one-time customers into recurring revenue with automated maintenance programs
target_audience: Pressure washing businesses wanting predictable monthly revenue
author: Josh Wash / BroBro

description.overview: Transform your pressure washing business from one-time jobs to recurring revenue streams. This snapshot includes automated maintenance program enrollment, seasonal reminders, referral systems, and customer loyalty workflows. Built to maximize customer lifetime value and create predictable monthly income.
key_benefits: Automated enrollment in quarterly/annual maintenance programs
Seasonal service reminders (spring cleaning, fall prep, etc.)
Referral program that turns customers into brand ambassadors
Birthday and anniversary touchpoints for relationship building
Upsell workflows for additional services (gutter cleaning, window washing)
ideal_for: Established pressure washing companies with existing customer base
Businesses looking to stabilize cash flow with recurring revenue
Companies wanting to reduce marketing costs through retention
Service providers ready to build a subscription-based model

workflows.name: Post-Service Maintenance Offer
workflows.trigger: Service marked as completed in pipeline
steps: Wait 1 hour after service completion
SMS with review request and maintenance program intro
Email next day with full maintenance program details and pricing
SMS 3 days later with limited-time enrollment discount
Phone call attempt after 7 days if no enrollment
Final email with social proof and testimonials
workflows.purpose: Convert one-time customers into maintenance program members

workflows.name: Quarterly Service Reminder
workflows.trigger: Customer enrolled in quarterly maintenance plan
steps: Email 2 weeks before due date with scheduling link
SMS 1 week before with calendar booking
Phone call if not scheduled 3 days before
Schedule automatically if customer doesn't respond
workflows.purpose: Ensure maintenance customers stay on schedule

workflows.name: Seasonal Service Campaign
workflows.trigger: Start of spring, summer, fall seasons
steps: Email announcing seasonal services available
SMS with limited-time seasonal discount (48-hour window)
Follow-up email with before/after photos
Final SMS reminder before offer expires
workflows.purpose: Generate additional revenue from seasonal services

workflows.name: Referral Reward Workflow
steps: Immediate thank you SMS
Track when referral books appointment
SMS notification when they earn reward
Automatically apply discount to next service
Bonus reward email after 3 successful referrals

workflows.name: Win-Back Inactive Customers
steps: Friendly 'we miss you' email with photos of recent work
SMS with special 'welcome back' offer
Email highlighting new services or improvements
Phone call from owner/manager for high-value customers
Final SMS with urgent limited-time offer
workflows.purpose: Re-engage customers who haven't booked recently

workflows.name: Birthday/Anniversary Touchpoint
workflows.trigger: Customer birthday or anniversary of first service
steps: Personalized birthday email with special gift
SMS with discount code for birthday month
Anniversary email celebrating relationship with case study
Offer VIP maintenance program upgrade
workflows.purpose: Build emotional connection and drive loyalty

workflows.name: Upsell Additional Services
steps: Wait 3 days after service
Email introducing complementary services (gutters, windows, roof)
SMS with bundle discount for multiple services
Follow-up email with seasonal timing recommendations
Phone call for high-value properties
workflows.purpose: Increase average customer value through service expansion

prerequisites: Payment processor set up (Stripe or Square)
import_steps: Step 1: Import the snapshot into your sub-account
Step 2: Import existing customer list with service history
Step 3: Configure maintenance program pricing and plans
Step 4: Set up payment processing for recurring billing
Step 5: Activate workflows (review each one carefully)
post_import_configuration: Task 1: Set up Stripe subscriptions for maintenance programs
Task 2: Configure referral reward structure and discount codes
Task 3: Create seasonal service offerings calendar
Task 4: Import customer birthdays if available
Task 5: Train team on maintenance program benefits and selling points
Task 6: Set up automated billing notifications
important_notes: Maintenance programs require payment processor integration
Review all automated billing workflows carefully before activation
Set clear terms for maintenance program cancellations
Train staff on handling maintenance member inquiries
Consider offering grandfather pricing for existing customers

quick_customizations: Adjust maintenance program pricing and tiers
Modify seasonal service offerings based on your region
Customize referral rewards (discount amount, free service, etc.)
Update birthday offer to match your pricing
advanced_customizations: Add commercial maintenance options with different schedules
Create VIP tier for high-value customers
Build out service bundles (pressure washing + gutter + windows)
Integrate with accounting software for revenue tracking
branding_checklist: Maintenance program name (e.g., 'Josh Wash Protection Plan')
Referral program name (e.g., 'Friends of Josh Wash')

best_practices: Offer maintenance program enrollment immediately after first service (highest conversion)
Make quarterly plans the default recommendation (more touchpoints = more revenue)
Give maintenance members priority scheduling and booking windows
Send personalized thank you notes to referrers (handwritten for high-value customers)
Offer a 'pause' option instead of cancellation for maintenance members
Use seasonal campaigns to upsell additional services to maintenance members
Track customer lifetime value and focus retention efforts on high-CLV segments
Implement win-back campaigns at 6 months and 12 months of inactivity
Celebrate customer milestones (1 year, 5 years) with special recognition
A/B test referral reward amounts to find optimal incentive level

common_use_cases.scenario: Customer just received first pressure washing service
tips: Strike while the iron is hot - they just saw your great work
Emphasize convenience and never having to remember to schedule
Offer limited-time enrollment bonus (10% off first maintenance service)

common_use_cases.scenario: Maintenance member's quarterly service is coming due
tips: Start reminders 2 weeks early to ensure you get on their calendar
Mention any seasonal issues they should address now
Don't be pushy - focus on relationship
Show them what they've missed (new services, improvements)
Make it easy to say yes with a strong welcome-back offer

integrations_required.purpose: Handle recurring billing for maintenance programs
Track recurring revenue and customer lifetime value
